intro: Cacalia pentaloba var. sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Cacalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable addition to woodland gardens. Its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage make it a desirable ornamental plant in botanical collections.
